text: Walter Yetnikoff (August 11, 1933 â€“ August 8, 2021) was an American music industry businessman. He was the president of CBS Records International from 1971 to 1975 and then president and CEO of CBS Records from 1975 to 1990. He was known for helping produce many Michael Jackson music albums. He was born in New York City. Yetnikoff was born in New York City. Yetnikoff died on August 8, 2021 in Bridgeport, Connecticut from bladder cancer, just three days before his 88th birthday. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Cancer deaths in Connecticut Category:Deaths from bladder cancer
title: Walter Yetnikoff
